p: A similar trend in the TBARS assessment was obtained in all treatments. Lee et al. ( 2016) showed that the permeability to gases such as oxygen is one of the crucial parameters of films that may govern the lipid oxidation of the cheese. So probably cheese samples that were coated with the B. persicum EO accompanied by LPOS film had less contact with oxygen. These results reveal that the oxygen barrier property of the coating was intensified by the addition of B. persicum EO and LPOS, in which further inhibition of the lipid oxidation of the cheese by decreasing the oxygen content in the packaging was achieved.
